title: Understand Enthalpy in a Cycle
text: Enthalpy is a state function, meaning its total change depends only on the initial and final states of a system—regardless of the path taken.

title: Analyze Cycle's Properties
text: In a complete thermodynamic cycle, the system returns to its initial state. Given that enthalpy is a state function, what does this imply about the change in enthalpy (ΔH)?

title: Reversible and Spontaneous Processes
text: Consider how reversible and spontaneous processes affect state functions in a cyclic process. What significance does this have for ΔH?

title: Final Conclusion on ΔH
text: When a system completes a cycle and returns to its original state, what is the change in enthalpy for the entire cycle? Think about the properties of state functions.
